title: About This Project
text:
This project explores how AI is reshaping the job market in 2024.



Vidhi A. Sharma
Soham Deskhhaire
Nhan (Johnny) Huynh




As students applying for internships, we wanted to uncover why job applications often feel like sending messages into the void.

title: About This Project
text:
Vidhi A. Sharma
Soham Deskhhaire
Nhan (Johnny) Huynh

title: About This Project
text: As students applying for internships, we wanted to uncover why job applications often feel like sending messages into the void.

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text:
Job hunting in 2024 is a rollercoaster—except it’s less “fun amusement park” and more “trapped in a Zoom call with no exit.” AI is taking jobs, recruiters are ghosting, and salary gaps are growing faster than my stress levels.
This report is for job seekers who just want answers—not generic LinkedIn advice like “just be yourself!” (We tried that, and yet here we are, still unemployed).



Is AI helping or ruining careers? (Spoiler: It depends.)
Why do recruiters ghost more than bad Tinder dates?
Who’s getting the best salaries, and is it too late to switch careers?
How do you actually beat Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS)?

Using data from Lightcast, World Economic Forum, and hiring platforms, we analyze trends and give realistic career advice. Buckle up—this might hurt, but at least it’s honest.




title: “Job Market Findings: AI, Ghosting, & Salary Drama” format: html toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl

title: Key Findings on Job Market Trends
text:
Internal Changes: Hiring priorities, budgets, or restructuring shifts.
Process Inefficiencies: Recruiters are overwhelmed with too many applications.
Ghost Jobs: Fake job postings to appear expanding or build a candidate pool.

title: Key Findings on Job Market Trends
text:
AI is displacing jobs in clerical work, finance, and IT.
Jobs Most at Risk: Data entry, accounting, investment analysis.
New AI Jobs: AI Ethics Specialists, AI Trainers, Data Scientists.

title: Key Findings on Job Market Trends
text: AI-related jobs are earning 77.53% more than traditional occupations.

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
Our findings are based on real job market data from Lightcast, the World Economic Forum, and labor market reports.
➡ Visualizations & interactive charts included!
👥 Authors: Vidhi A. Sharma, Soham Deshkhaire, Nhan (Johnny) Huynh
📅 Published: 2024
📂 GitHub Repository: Project Link

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text: title: “Key Findings: AI vs. Non-AI Careers” format: html: toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl —

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
2.1 📉 Jobs AI Is Replacing
AI-driven automation is rapidly eliminating traditional jobs across industries:
📌 Clerical & Admin Work → Data Entry Clerks, Secretaries
📌 Retail & Banking → Cashiers, Bank Tellers
📌 Customer Service → AI Chatbots replacing human agents
📌 Manufacturing → Automated assembly lines replacing factory workers

“Machines don’t call in sick, but they also don’t innovate.” – Industry Expert

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
2.2 📈 AI-Powered Job Growth
Despite job losses, AI is creating new career opportunities:
✔ Data Science & AI Engineering → 400% increase in job postings
✔ Cybersecurity Analysts → High demand due to AI-driven fraud risks
✔ AI Ethics & Compliance Experts → Regulatory demand is booming
✔ Healthcare AI Specialists → AI-assisted diagnostics & robotics surgery
💡 Industries experiencing AI-powered growth:
Tech, Finance, Healthcare, E-Commerce, Cybersecurity

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?

3.3 📌 Resume & ATS Optimization
To beat AI-powered hiring systems, job seekers must:
✔ Use AI-friendly keywords (skills like Python, TensorFlow, NLP)
✔ Quantify achievements (e.g., “Improved AI model accuracy by 30%”)
✔ Customize applications for each job (avoid generic resumes)

“AI is choosing who gets hired – learn how to game the system.”

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
text:
2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
Ghosting is no longer just for dating. A 2024 survey found that 52% of job seekers never heard back after multiple interview rounds (Herschberg, 2024).

2.1.1 Why Do Companies Ghost?

Internal Chaos: Budget cuts, layoffs, or leadership playing “musical chairs.”
Recruiter Burnout: Some recruiters manage hundreds of applicants per job (so yes, your “just checking in” email is lost in the abyss).
Fake Jobs? Yep. Some listings are just for show—used to collect resumes or gauge market interest (Herschberg, 2024).



2.1.2 How to Beat the Ghosting Game

Always ask for a hiring timeline. If they don’t give one, it’s a red flag.
Follow up—but no begging. Twice is enough. After that, move on.
Network like your career depends on it (because it does). Referrals triple your chances of getting hired (Greenhouse, 2024).

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
text:
2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
AI isn’t just replacing workers—it’s reshaping entire industries. The World Economic Forum predicts 85 million jobs will disappear by 2025, but 97 million new ones will emerge (WEF, 2023). So, it’s like musical chairs… but with robots.

2.2.1 Jobs Most at Risk:

Clerical/Admin: If your job involves copy-pasting all day, AI has bad news for you.
Customer Support: Chatbots are stealing jobs faster than customers can say, “I want to speak to a manager!”
Manufacturing & Retail: Self-checkouts don’t call in sick.



2.2.2 Jobs AI is Creating

AI Ethics Consultants: Someone has to stop AI from ruining everything.
Data Analysts & Scientists: AI needs humans to fix its mistakes.
Cybersecurity Experts: AI is smart, but hackers are smarter.

3.1 1. In-Demand Skills That Actually Matter
If you want job security, forget “teamwork” and “communication” on your resume—these skills will get you hired:

Machine Learning & AI (Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Data Science & Analytics (SQL, R, data visualization)
Cybersecurity (Cloud security, ethical hacking)
Marketing Analytics (SEO, AI-driven campaigns)
Project Management (Agile, Scrum, Jira)

How to Learn These Skills - Google Certificates (Free on Coursera) - Udemy & YouTube (Free AI courses exist!) - Build a portfolio (Hiring managers love real-world projects).

title: Career Strategy for AI vs. Non-AI Job Seekers
text:
The rapid rise of AI-powered careers has left many job seekers wondering: “Should I pivot towards AI, or are traditional careers still viable?”
This section provides a data-driven roadmap for career success in 2024, including in-demand skills, high-paying roles, and resume optimization strategies.

title: Career Strategy for AI vs. Non-AI Job Seekers
section: 2 1️⃣ The Most In-Demand AI & Tech Skills
text:
2 1️⃣ The Most In-Demand AI & Tech Skills
AI-driven careers require specific skill sets that are increasingly in demand. Below are the top technical and soft skills for AI-related roles.







Category
Key Skills in Demand (2024)




Technical Skills
Python, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, SQL, NLP


Data Skills
Data Science, Business Analytics, Visualization


Cloud & DevOps
AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, MLOps


Soft Skills
Critical Thinking, AI Ethics, Problem-Solving



✅ Tip: Learning AI-powered tools like ChatGPT, TensorFlow, and Power BI can boost your resume.

title: Career Strategy for AI vs. Non-AI Job Seekers
section: 3 2️⃣ Interactive Visualization: AI vs. Non-AI Job Salaries
text: 3 2️⃣ Interactive Visualization: AI vs. Non-AI Job Salaries

title: Career Strategy for AI vs. Non-AI Job Seekers
text:
4 3️⃣ Career Strategy Recommendations
Here are six practical career strategies for adapting to AI-driven job market changes:

Invest in AI & Data Science Skills 📊

Learn Python, Machine Learning, and AI-driven analytics.

Take courses in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Big Data.

Target High-Growth AI Industries 🚀

Prioritize careers in finance, tech, and healthcare, where AI adoption is rising.

Embrace AI-Powered Work Environments 💡

Stay ahead by using automation tools and AI-powered platforms in daily tasks.

Develop Soft Skills for AI Collaboration 🤝

Strengthen critical thinking, creativity, and emotional intelligence to work effectively alongside AI.

Build interdisciplinary skills (e.g., combining AI with marketing, finance, or healthcare).

Build an AI-Enhanced Personal Brand 🌐

Use LinkedIn, GitHub, and personal blogs to showcase AI-related projects.

Publish AI-driven case studies or portfolio projects to attract employers.

Stay Updated with Emerging AI Trends 📢

Follow AI industry leaders, attend conferences, and take part in AI hackathons.

Subscribe to AI-focused publications like MIT Technology Review, Google AI Blog, and OpenAI research.

title: Career Strategy for AI vs. Non-AI Job Seekers
text:
5 4️⃣ Personal Career Plan
Each job seeker should create a customized roadmap based on their career goals. This includes:

Skill Development: Identify technical and soft skills required for your desired role.

Industry Research: Follow hiring trends in AI and traditional careers.

Resume Optimization: Tailor your resume with AI-related skills and projects.

title: Career Strategy
text:
Upskill in AI & Data Science

Pursue courses on machine learning, AI ethics, and automation.
Leverage platforms like Coursera, Udacity, and LinkedIn Learning.

Adapt to Hybrid Work Environments

Develop proficiency in remote collaboration tools (Slack, Zoom, etc.).
Balance AI-assisted productivity with human-centered problem-solving.

Optimize Resumes for ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems)

Utilize AI-friendly resume formats to enhance visibility.
Tailor applications using industry-specific keywords (Massachusetts (2024)).

Strengthen Human Skills

Focus on problem-solving, emotional intelligence, and creative thinking.
Build leadership and adaptability to work alongside AI systems.
